sentences.en: At that, Reno lost her cool composure.
sentences.cn: 听了那句话，雷诺失去了冷静。

sentences.en: But he waited until Ottenshawe had regained his composure.
sentences.cn: 但他还是等到奥敦肖平静下来.

sentences.en: For a minute he looked uncertain, and then recovered his composure.
sentences.cn: 有一小会儿他看上去有些迟疑不定，之后又恢复了镇定。

sentences.en: For once Dimbleby lost his composure. It was all he could do to stop tears of mirth falling down his cheeks.
sentences.cn: 这一次丁布尔比没能控制住自己的感情。他唯一能做的也就是不让欢乐的泪水流下脸庞。

sentences.en: He has lost his composure under the pressure of the situation.
sentences.cn: 他不堪形势的压力，失去了冷静。

sentences.en: He showed great composure in difficult situations.
sentences.cn: 他在困难环境中表现得极沉着。

sentences.en: He was obviously very shocked but he soon regained his composure.
sentences.cn: 显然,他很震惊,但很快又恢复了镇静.

sentences.en: He wondered at her composure in such a crisis.
sentences.cn: 他很惊讶,在这样的危机中,她竟泰然自若.

sentences.en: It took him a while to regain his composure.
sentences.cn: 他过了一会儿才恢复镇定。

sentences.en: Nothing could ruffle the perfect composure with which she casually greets members of staff.
sentences.cn: 什么都不能扰乱她随意地和员工打招呼时流露出的那种镇定自若。

sentences.en: Stopping only briefly to regain her composure, she described her agonising ordeal.
sentences.cn: 她只停顿了一小会儿让自己恢复平静，然后讲述了她无比痛苦的经历。

sentences.en: The cross-legged deity exudes wisdom and composure.
sentences.cn: 盘腿而坐的神像散发出智慧与沉静的气息。

sentences.en: The editor was thankful, and resumed his composure.
sentences.cn: 编辑松了口气, 恢复了镇定.

sentences.en: Throughout the crisis he retained his composure.
sentences.cn: 危机期间,他始终保持镇定.

sentences.en: We should frame our minds to the becoming composure of still - life.
sentences.cn: 我们应当培养出准备变成静物的那种泰然自若的心情.

words.tran_cn: 组成；作曲（compose的过去分词）；著作
构成；写作；使平静；排…的版

trans.tran_cn: 镇静，沉着，头脑镇定或沉着的状态
trans.tran_en: the state of feeling or seeming calm
